result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Preston A Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, if after two years if no new violations of the law and no municipal tickets, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Preston A Smith in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Fine of $150.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid forthwith or serve 5 days in the House of Correction.  Due to low income.  

 Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, if after two years if no new violations of the law and no municipal tickets, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Preston A Smith in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Preston A Smith not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case originally set for 5/11/2015. Defense waived defendant's appearance. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Defense requests an adjournment. Court granted request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eric M. Vega in court, defendant Preston A Smith not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Preston A Smith in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  
Defendant Preston A Smith in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Preston A Smith
Current: 4511 West Spencer Place (Upper), Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 03-08-2015)
Prior: 4511 West Spencer Place, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Preston A Smith not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 3-5-2015. Defendant is in custody at Milw. County Jail. Both files sent to case prep.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/5/15 @ 1:30 pm
